text: The Pontiac Bonneville was an American automobile. It was introduced in 1957 and discontinued in 2005 model year. The Bonneville was available as a convertible, sedan or coupe. This car was distributed through the Pontiac division of General Motors. It was named after the salt flats of Bonneville, Utah. The Bonneville ran for ten generations, each with distinct styling and engineering. Bonnevilles came with either V6 or V8 configuration engines, producing anywhere from 135 horsepower to 390 horsepower, depending on model. ==References== Category:1950s automobiles Category:1960s automobiles Category:1970s automobiles Category:1980s automobiles Category:1990s automobiles Category:2000s automobiles Category:Pontiac automobiles
title: Pontiac Bonneville
